section.title: How to get Code Assist for Seam specific resources in an externally generated project?
section.para: To get Code Assist for Seam specific resources in an externally generated project, you should enable Seam features in Project Preferences. Right click an imported project and navigate PropertiesSeam Settings. Check Seam support box to enable all available .

section.title: How to import an example Seam project from jboss-eap directory?
section.para: To import an example Seam project from jboss-eap into your working directory, you should perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Go to NewOtherJava Project from Existing Buildfile
Point to the build.xml of any chosen project by pressing Browse button
Hit Finish to open the project

section.para: As these seam examples are non WTP projects, next you should enable Seam support for them. To do that, right click the project and go to PropertiesSeam Settings.

important.para: Projects are not directly deployable unless they are in the correct state, such as an archive created through Project Archives. As an alternative, working examples are provided for Seam by navigating to Help Project Examples Seam

section.title: How to change the deploy folders for Seam source code from src/hot and src/main?
section.para: You should right-click the project, select PropertiesJava Build Path, then switch to the Source tab, select the output folder for src/hot ( src/main) and click Edit to change their output location.
